articles.headline: Recycling Land for Green Energy Ideas
articles.snippet: Land taken out of farm production for lack of water is being proposed for solar projects. Utilities and farmers are interested.
articles.abstract: Land taken out of farm production for lack of water is being proposed for solar projects. Utilities and farmers are interested.
articles.lead_paragraph: LEMOORE, Calif.  Thousands of acres of farmland here in the San Joaquin Valley have been removed from agricultural production, largely because the once fertile land is contaminated by salt buildup from years of irrigation.

articles.headline: For Those With Jobs, a Recession With Benefits
articles.snippet: For the employed, wages are rising and lack of inflation is strengthening purchasing power.
articles.abstract: For the employed, wages are rising and lack of inflation is strengthening purchasing power.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the distinctive features of the Great Recession has been the enormous number of people who have been out of work for months on end. Almost 45 percent of today’s unemployed workers have been without a job for at least 27 weeks. In no other downturn since World War II did the share exceed 26 percent.

articles.headline: Fed Move on Debt Signals Concern About Economy
articles.snippet: By buying government debt, the Fed is taking a step to maintain the large amount of money that it began pumping into the economy in 2007.
articles.abstract: By buying government debt, the Fed is taking a step to maintain the large amount of money that it began pumping into the economy in 2007.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Federal Reserve officials, acknowledging that their confidence in the recovery had dimmed, moved again on Tuesday to keep interest rates low and encourage economic growth. They also signaled that more aggressive measures could follow if the job market and other indicators continued to weaken.

articles.headline: Early U.S. Tests Find No Toyota Flaw in Electronics
articles.snippet: Findings by a federal safety agency support Toyota’s claim that it had identified and was fixing the reasons that its vehicles might accelerate out of control.
articles.abstract: Findings by a federal safety agency support Toyota’s claim that it had identified and was fixing the reasons that its vehicles might accelerate out of control.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  The government’s investigation into complaints of sudden acceleration of Toyota vehicles has found no evidence of flawed electronics in 58 of the vehicles that crashed, federal regulators said Tuesday.

articles.headline: Incumbent Backed by Obama Wins Colorado Primary
articles.snippet: Senator Michael Bennet survived a bitter challenge in the Democratic primary, while an insurgent beat the Republican party favorite.
articles.abstract: Senator Michael Bennet survived a bitter challenge in the Democratic primary, while an insurgent beat the Republican party favorite.
articles.lead_paragraph: DENVER  The predictions of doom for incumbents and establishment candidates this campaign season are proving to be more complex in the real world. On Tuesday, Senator Michael Bennet of Colorado, a Democrat who had hitched his star to the fortunes of President Obama, survived a bitter primary challenge.

articles.headline: In the Rearview Mirror, Oklahoma and Death Row
articles.snippet: After 28 years in prison, James Fisher got a plea deal that came with one stipulation: that he leave the state forever.
articles.abstract: After 28 years in prison, James Fisher got a plea deal that came with one stipulation: that he leave the state forever.

articles.headline: BP Station Owners Face Long Road to Recovery
articles.snippet: BP owns just a fraction of the U.S. service stations that carry its brand, but independent station owners are suffering since the spill.
articles.abstract: BP owns just a fraction of the U.S. service stations that carry its brand, but independent station owners are suffering since the spill.
articles.lead_paragraph: BP owns fewer than 2 percent of the 10,000 stations across the country that carry its brand, but that did not spare its independent station owners from boycotts, protests, vandalism and customer tirades about fouled beaches and oiled wildlife during the more than three months that crude flowed into the Gulf of Mexico.

articles.headline: California Unions Take Pay Protest to Movies
articles.snippet: State workers in California plan to protest furloughs by demonstrating at a movie in which their governor will make a cameo appearance.
articles.abstract: State workers in California plan to protest furloughs by demonstrating at a movie in which their governor will make a cameo appearance.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  State workers across the country have long complained about budget-cutting by way of furloughs and pay cuts. Now California’s state employee unions are taking the fight to the wellspring of Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger’s popularity: the big screen.

articles.headline: In Mission With Afghan Police, Issues of Trust
articles.snippet: This battalion is training the local police — and working alongside them in the most contested hamlets in the area.
articles.abstract: This battalion is training the local police — and working alongside them in the most contested hamlets in the area.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHAHAR DARREH, Afghanistan — On paper, the plan for the foot patrol looked perfectly safe. A stroll through a couple of villages. Introductions to a few village elders. A two-mile drive back to the guarded walls of the Afghan police headquarters. Easy.

articles.headline: Market Drop Signals Fears About Global Recovery
articles.snippet: As the American economic recovery wavers, evidence is mounting that growth overseas is also slowing and may be unable to sustain the fragile rebound in the United States.
articles.abstract: As the American economic recovery wavers, evidence is mounting that growth overseas is also slowing and may be unable to sustain the fragile rebound in the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: As economic recovery wavers in the United States, evidence is mounting that growth abroad is also slowing and may be unable to sustain the fragile rebound here.
articles.byline: By Graham Bowley and Christine Hauser
